meanings.definition: Capable of being melted or fused.
meanings.sent1: The wax was fusible in the heat, turning into a liquid.
meanings.sent2: The chocolate became fusible when left in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The fusible crayons made for a colorful mess when left in the car.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt as fusible as candle wax in his warm presence.
meanings.sent5: The ice cream was so fusible under the hot sun that it dripped everywhere.

meanings.definition: Able to be blended or combined easily.
meanings.sent1: The paint colors were fusible, creating a beautiful new shade.
meanings.sent2: Their ideas were fusible, leading to a successful collaboration.
meanings.sent3: The fusible ingredients in the recipe made cooking seem like magic.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was as fusible as two liquids mixing seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The different fabrics were so fusible that they merged into a unique design.
